context: The Estonian word 'elama' is an infinitive verb that means 'to live' or 'to reside'. It indicates the state of being alive or inhabiting a particular place. In different conjugations, it can refer to living in a location (Ma elan Tallinnas - I live in Tallinn), cohabitating with family (Ta elab koos oma perega - He lives with his family), or simply existing/being alive (Elame koos heas korteris - We live together in a nice apartment).
